titleStmt.title: receipt of a loan
titleStmt.author: Pausiris son of Pausiris and Thaesis

msContents.summary: Peceiptof a loan. Loan from wife to husband providing security to Tauris in case of separation, particularly during her pregnancy. All objects were apparently sold and the proceeds used for paying the loans (P.Mich. inv. 84, inv. 86 and 85). The document is invalidated, but the marriage continued. Repaid throught P.Mich. inv. 89

msItemStruct.note: There is one more glass with mounted papyri with inv. no 74-94 at the end of the series of glasses concerning the archive. Locker B. There are 8 fragmnets that could be parts of 3 or 4 papyri.
Pub. status: under research; contact institution

P.Mich. inv. 72; P.Mich. inv. 73; P.Mich. inv. 74; P.Mich. inv. 75; P.Mich. inv. 76; P.Mich. inv. 77; P.Mich. inv. 78; P.Mich. inv. 79; P.Mich. inv. 80; P.Mich. inv. 81; P.Mich. inv. 82; P.Mich. inv. 83; P.Mich. inv. 84; P.Mich. inv. 85; P.Mich. inv. 86; P.Mich. inv. 87; P.Mich. inv. 88; P.Mich. inv. 89; P.Mich. inv. 90; P.Mich. inv. 91; P.Mich. inv. 93; P.Mich. inv. 94

condition.ab: Broken off at the bottom. Many holes in the middle of the document at the points it was folded.

handDesc.p: Three hands: Hand 1: lines 1-18: cursive handwriting, experient, with many ligatures. Hand 2: lines 18-24. Letters upright separately written Hand 3: lines 25-30. A horizontal stroke has been drawn below the last line of each hand.

origin.persName: Pausiris son of Pausiris and Thaesis
Tauris daughter of Tauris daughter of Annibas

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

listBibl.bibl: Gagos T - Koenen L - McNellen BE, A First Century Archive from Oxyrhynchos or Oxyrhynchite Loan Contracts and Egyptian Marriage. In J.H. Johnson (ed.), Life in a Multi-cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond, Chicago 1992,, chapter 19, p. 181-205 (esp. p. 200), 1992, pl. 19.1
